info: Determines the movement rate of monsters.  A higher value increases monster speed and a lower reduces it.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_SPEED

info: Allowed point pools for character generation.
default: Default: any - Values: any, multi_pool, no_freeform
name: CHARACTER_POINT_POOLS

info: If true, emulates zombie hordes.  Zombies can group together into hordes, which can wander around cities and will sometimes move towards noise.  Note: the current implementation does not properly respect obstacles, so hordes can appear to walk through walls under some circumstances.  Must reset world directory after changing for it to take effect.
name: WANDER_SPAWNS

info: (WIP feature) Determines terrain, shops, plants, and more.
name: DEFAULT_REGION

info: If true, radiation causes the player to mutate.
name: RAD_MUTATION

info: Season length, in days.  Warning: Very little other than the duration of seasons scales with this value, so adjusting it may cause nonsensical results.
name: SEASON_LENGTH

info: Day/night cycle settings.  'Normal' sets a normal cycle.  'Eternal Day' sets eternal day.  'Eternal Night' sets eternal night.
default: Default: normal - Values: normal, day, night
name: ETERNAL_TIME_OF_DAY

info: A scaling factor that determines the time between monster upgrades.  A higher number means slower evolution.  Set to 0.00 to turn off monster upgrades.
name: MONSTER_UPGRADE_FACTOR

info: If true, spawn zombies at shelters.  Makes the starting game a lot harder.
name: BLACK_ROAD

info: A number determining how far apart cities are.  A higher number means cities are further apart.  Warning, small numbers lead to very slow mapgen.
name: CITY_SPACING

info: If true, keep the initial season for ever.
name: ETERNAL_SEASON

info: Sets the time of construction in percents.  '50' is two times faster than default, '200' is two times longer.  '0' automatically scales construction time to match the world's season length.
name: CONSTRUCTION_SCALING

info: How many days into the year the Cataclysm ended.  Day 0 is Spring 1.  Day -1 randomizes the start date.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  This does not advance food rot or monster evolution.
name: INITIAL_DAY

info: Determines how much damage monsters can take.  A higher value makes monsters more resilient and a lower makes them more flimsy.  Requires world reset.
name: MONSTER_RESILIENCE

info: A scaling factor that determines density of monster spawns.  A higher number means more monsters.
name: SPAWN_DENSITY

info: A scaling factor that determines density of item spawns.  A higher number means more items.
name: ITEM_SPAWNRATE

info: A number determining how large cities are.  A higher number means larger cities.  0 disables cities, roads and any scenario requiring a city start.
name: CITY_SIZE

info: How many days after the end of the Cataclysm the player spawns.  Day 0 is immediately after the end of the Cataclysm.  Can be overridden by scenarios.  Increasing this will cause food rot and monster evolution to advance.
name: SPAWN_DELAY

info: Initial starting time of day on character generation.
name: INITIAL_TIME

info: Handling of game world when last character dies.
default: Default: reset - Values: reset, delete, query, keep
name: WORLD_END

info: Baseline average number of days between random NPC spawns.  Average duration goes up with the number of NPCs already spawned.  A higher number means fewer NPCs.  Set to 0 days to disable random NPCs.
name: NPC_SPAWNTIME
